problems.title: Error 1: LiDAR Turret Jammed
problems.description: The orange turret on top isn't spinning.
solution_steps: Spin the turret by hand to dislodge debris.
Use compressed air to blow out dust.
If motor failed, replace the LDS unit.

problems.title: Mop Bracket Issues
problems.description: Mop cloth falls off or bracket cracked.

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the issue on a S5 Max Robot Vacuum?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement part typically costs significantly less than a new $548 vacuum, and extending the life of your Roborock is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my S5 Max Robot Vacuum needs a new part?
faqs.answer: Common signs include reduced performance and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the part on my S5 Max Robot Vacuum myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
